mods.abstract: Information Wanted !!! I HAVE in my possession seven negroes viz: George Bledso, black, 6 feet high, about 50 years old - has free papers from Clerk's Office, New Orleans, La. Said he was born free in Raleigh N. C. Ann Convers, black woman, small size, about 50 years old. has free papers from Clerk's Office, New Orleans, La. Both of the above negroes say their home is in New Orleans. George Allen Queller, copper complexion, 5 feet 10 inches high, about 35 years old - said he was free and a citizen of New York; left there three years since. John Kelsoe, copper complexion, 5 feet ten inches high; said he was made free by his master, who lives in Rapides Parish, La. Calvin Glover, copper complexion, 5 feet 8 inches high, about 25 years old - said he was free, but has no free papers. Joseph Thompson, copper complexion, 5 feet 8 inches high; barber by trade; said he was free, but has no free papers. Lewis Nolan, light black, 5 feet ten inches high - about twenty years old - said he is a slave, and belonged to the estate of Alce La Branch, and was taken from his home in Louisiana, by the Yankees. sometime in 1863, and carried to New Orleans - shipped from there on steamer ""Ike Davis,"" as assistant cook. All the above named negroes were captured from the steamer ""Ike Davis,"" in November, 1864, and it was ordered and decreed by the Hon. Confederate States Court, for the Western District of Texas, that the said negroes be hirded out by the Marshal for the purpose of payin gthe costs of their suit and support; and that the Marshall shall advertise said negroes, with a full description of the same, in the San Antonio Herald, and some newspaper published in Shreveport and Alexandria, La., until farther action is taken in the matter - or until the owner or owners can come forward and prove property and pay the costs, and have the same. J. R. JEFFERSON, Marhsal West. Dist. Texas. Seguin. Jan. 24th. 1865. Shreverport News and Alexandria Democrate please copy four times, and send bill to this office. feb14:4t.
mods.note: George Bledso (50); Ann Convers (50); George Allen Queller (35); John Kelsoe; Calvin Glover (25); Joseph Thompson; Lewis Nolan (20)
Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )

mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
